abstract.text: Copies a block of pixels into a section of texture slice 0.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The location of a block of pixels in the texture slice. The region must be within the dimensions of the slice.
A zero-indexed value that specifies which mipmap level is the destination. If the texture doesn’t have mipmaps, use
A pointer to the bytes in memory to copy.
The stride, in bytes, of one row in the source data. For
and
, use

. For raw and packed pixel types, the stride is the number of pixels in one row. For compressed pixel formats, the stride is the number of bytes from the beginning of one row of blocks to the beginning of the next. When source data consists of only a single row, use
Your data type determines how you should compute
For raw or packed pixel data, use a value greater than or equal to the size of data in one row, and less than
For compressed pixel data, use a multiple of the compression block size. When working with PowerVR Texture Compression (PVRTC), use
Nonzero values smaller than the texture width or not a multiple of the pixel size cause an error.

This method runs on the CPU and immediately copies the pixel data into the texture. It doesn’t synchronize against any GPU accesses to the texture. Ensure all operations that write or render to the texture complete before reading the texture’s contents, using one of the following methods:
Synchronize on the GPU with a
or
command in an
Synchronize on the CPU with a callback passed to the
method to handle completion asynchronously, or the
method to block thread execution until the GPU work completes.

If the texture image has a compressed pixel format, only write to block-aligned regions. If the size of a dimension of region isn’t a multiple of the block size, then include both the edge block and space up to the texture dimensions in
To copy your data to a private texture, copy your data to a temporary texture with non-private storage, and then use an
to copy the data to the private texture for GPU use.

abstract.text: The maximum representable integer in this type.
Render advanced 3D graphics and compute data in parallel with graphics processors.
An interface you can use to encode GPU commands that copy and modify the underlying memory of various Metal resources.
Encodes a command that synchronizes the CPU’s copy of a managed resource, such as a buffer or texture, so that it matches the GPU’s copy.
Encodes a command that synchronizes a part of the CPU’s copy of a texture so that it matches the GPU’s copy.
Registers a completion handler the GPU device calls immediately after the GPU finishes running the commands in the command buffer.
Blocks the current thread until the GPU finishes executing the command buffer and all of its completion handlers.
The data formats that describe the organization and characteristics of individual pixels in a texture.
The bounds for a subset of an object’s elements.
A resource that holds formatted image data.
Copies pixel data into a section of a texture slice.
Copies a block of pixels into a section of texture slice 0.
A one-dimensional texture image.
An array of one-dimensional texture images.
Specify which mipmaps that the data transfer affects.

abstract.text: Use a blit command encoder to copy buffer or texture data to a private resource.

doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Meta.title: Copying Data to a Private Resource

abstract.text: Optimize a texture’s data to improve GPU or CPU access.
Manually synchronize memory for a Metal resource in apps.

doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Meta.title: Synchronizing a Managed Resource in macOS

abstract.text: Describes an unsigned integer.
A raw pointer for accessing untyped data.
A signed integer value type.
